H0.text: Which amphibian did the ancients believe could live in fire. Salamandra

H1.text: Which amphibian did the ancients believe could live in fire. Bombina

H2.text: Which amphibian did the ancients believe could live in fire. Hyla

H3.text: Which amphibian did the ancients believe could live in fire. Urodela

A4.text: Pliny's description of physical markings suggest possible identification with the fire salamander (Salamandra salamandra), perhaps one of its subspecies.

A5.text: The salamander's mastery over fire is described by Aristotle in his History of Animals.
